I haven't been working with spack very long, but I've encountered a pain point with lmod lua file generations when either compiling variants or generating mixed toolchain installations. E.g.,

```
14:29:34-root@gosset:~/auto$ spack module lmod refresh -y | grep ^spec:
==> Error: Name clashes detected in module files:

file: /mnt/beegfs/spackroot/share/spack/lmod/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc/7.4.0/gettext/0.19.8.1.lua
spec: gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2 patches=9acdb4e73f67c241b5ef32505c9ddf7cf6884ca8ea661692f21dca28483b04b8 +tar+xz arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
spec: gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2 patches=9acdb4e73f67c241b5ef32505c9ddf7cf6884ca8ea661692f21dca28483b04b8 +tar+xz arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
spec: gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2 patches=9acdb4e73f67c241b5ef32505c9ddf7cf6884ca8ea661692f21dca28483b04b8 +tar+xz arch=linux-centos7-x86_64

file: /mnt/beegfs/spackroot/share/spack/lmod/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc/7.4.0/libxml2/2.9.8.lua
spec: libxml2@2.9.8%gcc@7.4.0~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
spec: libxml2@2.9.8%gcc@7.4.0~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64

==> Error: Operation aborted

```

The dreaded name clash! The issue on my end was primarily a lack of verbosity and information on why there were multiple copies of seemingly the same software, and it took some digging to extrapolate enough information on which packages were ripe for removal.

So given the above error, whats a quick way we can query these conflicts and determine which if any are necessary and can be removed. So I made a little bash script which I figured would be helpful to share. Idea being to find the hashes for the conflicting packages, list their dependents and then give the user the option to delete in a single automation script:


Say we name this run.sh
```
#!/bin/bash
### usage
### ./run <FULL NAME CONFLICT>

export PKG="$1"
export CUTT=`echo $PKG | sed 's/\@.*//g' | sed 's/\%.*//g'`
export INDEX=0

for f in $(spack uninstall $PKG | grep $CUTT |  awk '{print " /"$1}'); do
 echo "dependents for $PKG ""$f";
 spack dependents -i "$PKG ""$f";
 echo -ne "wanna uninstall his package (y/n default=n): "; read RESPONSE;
 if [ "$RESPONSE" = "y" ]; then
  spack uninstall --dependents -y "$PKG ""$f";
 fi
done

exit 0
```


So given the above name clashes:

```
14:38:50-root@gosset:~/auto$ ./run.sh gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2
==> Error: gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2 matches multiple packages:
==> Error: You can either:
    a) use a more specific spec, or
    b) use `spack uninstall --all` to uninstall ALL matching specs.

dependents for gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2 /3goeyvm
==> Dependents of gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0/3goeyvm
-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@7.4.0 -----------------------------
ylxqc2r binutils@2.31.1  zg3or6k glib@2.48.1
wanna uninstall his package (y/n default=n):
dependents for gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2 /22t5wpt
==> Dependents of gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0/22t5wpt
No dependents
wanna uninstall his package (y/n default=n): y
==> Successfully uninstalled gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2 patches=9acdb4e73f67c241b5ef32505c9ddf7cf6884ca8ea661692f21dca28483b04b8 +tar+xz arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 /22t5wpt
dependents for gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@7.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2 /3bvk4iv

14:40:03-root@gosset:~/auto$ ./run.sh libxml2@2.9.8%gcc@7.4.0~python
```

Just thought this might be slightly helpful for others experiencing similar issues.
